title: Ireland win Six Nations and first Grand Slam in Dublin
description: The 29-16 win against England is Ireland's first Six Nations title since 2018 and fourth Grand Slam.

title: Ecuador earthquake kills at least four, causes widespread damage
description: 6.7 magnitude tremor shakes coastal Guayas region, damaging homes and buildings.

title: What is the significance of the ICC’s arrest warrant for Putin?
description: Russian president charged with war crime by the International Criminal Court over deportations of Ukrainian children.

title: Protests in Italy as government restricts same-sex parent rights
description: Italy legalised same-sex civil unions in 2016 but stopped short of granting gay couples the right to adopt.

title: Protests held in France amid anger at Macron’s pension reform
description: Refinery strikes and demonstrations are held across France over anger at the government raising the state pension age.

title: Ukraine Black Sea grain export deal extended, UN and Turkey says
description: An agreement allowing Ukraine to ship grain from its Black Sea ports was due to expire on Saturday.

title: Gender equality isn’t possible without abortion and contraception
description: Access to reproductive health protects women and girls, uplifts them and allows them to prosper.

title: Putin visits Crimea after war crimes warrant issued against him
description: Russian president arrives in Crimea to mark the anniversary of the peninsula's 2014 annexation from Ukraine.

title: Donald Trump says he expects to be arrested on Tuesday
description: The twice-impeached former US president allegedly paid hush money to a porn star before the 2016 US election.

title: Russian attacks continue after ICC arrest warrant for Putin
description: Strikes on multiple fronts, including capital Kyiv and the western Lviv province, come hours after ICC's announcement.

title: Top Egypt, Turkey diplomats hold first Cairo talks in a decade
description: Diplomatic relations to be upgraded to ambassador level 'as soon as possible', say foreign ministers.

title: Jeffrey Marsh is wrong: Trans rights, parent concerns both matter
description: While trans rights must be upheld, parents and feminists worried about their children must be heard.

title: The woman who could be Nigeria’s first elected female governor
description: Aishatu Dahiru is seeking to make history as Nigeria's first elected female governor, in Saturday's election.

title: Millions of dead fish clog up Australian river near remote town
description: Authorities say 'millions' of fish died in the Darling River near the small town of Menindee in New South Wales.

title: Nigeria local elections open in shadow of contested national vote
description: New governors are being chosen for 28 states as opposition continues to reject victory of President-elect Bola Tinubu.

title: The BBC vs Gary Lineker: An own goal?
description: A debacle with sports host sparks a furious debate about free speech at the BBC. Plus, what could AI mean for the media?

title: Police raid Khan’s house as ex-Pakistan PM heads to court
description: Police seal parts of Islamabad and deploy thousands of officers for the court hearing on corruption charges.

title: US governor signs measure banning abortion pills in Wyoming
description: Wyoming's ban on abortion pills would take effect in July, pending any legal action that could delay that.

title: Tunisian president names ally as new interior minister
description: Former Tunis governor Kamal Feki was given the post, days after mass opposition protests took place in the country.

title: UK’s Braverman to discuss controversial migration deal in Rwanda
description: Several lawsuits have been filed to stop the conservative government from acting on a deportation agreement with Rwanda.

title: Can the ‘back-to-work’ budget boost economic growth in the UK?
description: The finance minister has put getting Britons back into work at the heart of his plan for economic growth.

title: N Korea says 800,000 youths volunteer to fight ‘US imperialists’
description: North Korean state media says the mass enlistment is in response to military drills between the US and South Korea.

title: Novak Djokovic denied US entry over COVID vaccine policy
description: Being vaccinated against COVID-19 remains a requirement of international travellers.

title: Karachi United: Giving hope to footballers in impoverished areas
description: Most of KU’s community centres operate out of low-income areas of Karachi.

title: Police clash with pension demonstrators for second night in Paris
description: Pension reform protests are gravest challenge to President Macron's authority since 2018 'Yellow Vest' demonstrations.

title: Russia gives awards to fighter pilots involved in US drone crash
description: US officials say surveillance flights over Black Sea have resumed despite Russia's downing of the MQ-9 Reaper drone.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 388
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 388th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: US Biden says war crimes charge against Russia’s Putin justified
description: Moscow says ICC charges against Vladimir Putin are meaningless with respect to jurisdiction in Russia.

title: Israeli forces shoot dead Palestinian man in latest bloodshed
description: At least 84 Palestinians have been killed so far in 2023, putting this year on track be one of the bloodiest.
